intro: Palicourea trianae, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and typically grows on the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients from them. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries that contain the seeds. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Due to its parasitic nature and ornamental appeal, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
